The curr_chunk is: "SECTION 1. AFFILIATED ISLAND ENERGY INDEPENDENCE TEAM."

The summarized chunk is: "Affiliated Island Energy Independence Team." The summarized chunk is: "Definitions of affiliated islands, Secretary, and team." The Secretary shall establish a team of experts to address energy needs of affiliated islands, reduce reliance on imported fossil fuels, increase use of nonfossil fuel sources, improve energy infrastructure efficiency, and enhance planning and education. The Secretary will establish a team to provide assistance in developing energy action plans for affiliated islands to reduce reliance on fossil fuels and improve energy infrastructure efficiency. The team will focus on planning, education, training, research-based approaches, economic development, job creation, and international engagement. The Secretary will establish a team to assist affiliated islands in developing energy action plans to reduce reliance on fossil fuels and improve energy infrastructure efficiency. The plans will include studies to assess opportunities for reducing fossil fuel use through improved energy efficiency and increased use of indigenous clean-energy resources. The Secretary will establish a team to assist affiliated islands in developing energy action plans to reduce reliance on fossil fuels and improve energy infrastructure efficiency. This includes identifying cost-effective strategies, promoting education and training activities, and coordinating efforts to leverage resources. The Secretary will establish a team to assist affiliated islands in developing energy action plans to reduce reliance on fossil fuels. This includes leveraging international entities, the Department of Energy, the Department of the Interior, and regional utilities, as well as identifying research-based and private-public partnership approaches. Additionally, any other necessary components will be determined to successfully reduce fossil fuel use. Reports to the Secretary will be submitted within 1 year of the team's establishment and biannually thereafter. The Secretary will establish a team to assist affiliated islands in developing energy action plans to reduce reliance on fossil fuels. The team will submit biannual reports on the progress of each island in implementing the Action Plan and reducing fossil fuel reliance. Regional utility organizations may be included in the team to provide expertise, and annual reports to Congress will be submitted within 30 days of receiving the team's report. The Secretary will submit a summary report to Congress upon receiving a report from the team. Authorization of appropriations is provided for the implementation of this section.
